      Gets the application list.

      Target API Endpoint: /application/list

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the application owner/manager SirqulKeys.keyword
      The keyword used to search for title, about, and description fields SirqulKeys.platforms
      Deprecated, use deviceIds and deviceVersions SirqulKeys.deviceIds
      The list of targeted device ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /audience/devices (pass in deviceId values) SirqulKeys.deviceVersions
      The list of targeted device version ranges that are aligned with the provided devices list (see devices param for possible values), comma separated; examples are:
      2.3-X, 0-5.1.4, 4.3.1-6.1.4 where X is no maximum and 0 is no minimum. SirqulKeys.categoryIds
      The list of category ids to filter the list by SirqulKeys.sortField
      The column to sort the search on, possible values include: UPDATED (default), CREATED, TITLE SirqulKeys.hasAds
      Filter results on whether the application supports ads or not.

      Target API Endpoint: /application/placement/delete

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically) SirqulKeys.placementId
      The id of the placement to delete, the user must have rights to the application the ad placement is for

      void searchApplications(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<ApplicationResponse>> callback)
      Search for applications matching the criteria that the logged in user has access to.

      Target API Endpoint: /application/search

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account ID of the logged in user making the request SirqulKeys.location of type Location
      The location of the device SirqulKeys.keyword
      The keyword used to search SirqulKeys.keywordSearchFields
      The columns to applied the keyword search to SirqulKeys.sortField
      The column to sort the search on SirqulKeys.descending
      determines whether the sorted list is in descending or ascending order SirqulKeys.start
      The record to begin the return set on SirqulKeys.limit
      The number of records to return SirqulKeys.hasAds
      Filter results on whether the application supports ads or not.

      Target API Endpoint: /application/update

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
      The application key for updating an existing application SirqulKeys.appName

      The text to display on the invite page SirqulKeys.invitePageUrl
      The url to the application invite page SirqulKeys.platforms
      A json object with a list of platforms supported.

      Updates an ad placement.

      Target API Endpoint: /application/placement/update

      The name of the placement SirqulKeys.description
      The description of the placement SirqulKeys.size

      The width of a custom ad size SirqulKeys.refreshInterval
      The refresh interval in seconds

      WrappedResponse<PlacementResponse> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.

        public ApplicationApi()

    • Method Detail

      • createApplication

        public void createApplication(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<ApplicationResponse> callback)
        Create an application record and one placement record for that application. You can create more placements for this application by using createApplicationPlacement(Map, ISirqulCallback). Each developer group can only create 10 applications.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.appName
          The name of the application
        • SirqulKeys.about
          The description of the application
        • SirqulKeys.bundleId
          The application bundle identifier (format - com.company.appName)
        • SirqulKeys.appIconAssetId
          The application icon asset id
        • SirqulKeys.appLogoAssetId
          The application logo asset id
        • SirqulKeys.facebookAppId
          The Facebook application id
        • SirqulKeys.facebookAppSecret
          The Facebook application secret
        • SirqulKeys.googleApiKey
          This is the either the "server key" or "browser key" generated from google to enable Google Cloud Messaging
        • SirqulKeys.updateEULADate
          Determines whether to update the EULA date
        • SirqulKeys.eulaVersion
          The EULA version
        • SirqulKeys.landingPageUrl
          The landing page URL
        • SirqulKeys.showInActivities
          Determines whether to show the application in the activity feed
        • SirqulKeys.activityDescription
          The description of the application in the activity feed
        • SirqulKeys.inviteWelcomeText
          The text to display on the invite page
        • SirqulKeys.invitePageUrl
          The url to the application invite page
        • SirqulKeys.platforms
          A json object with a list of supported platforms. 
           
 {platforms:[{
                'deviceId':1,
                'minimum':230,
                'maximum':421,
                'downloadUrl':'http://app.store.com/download',
                'description':'description and version info'
 }]}
          the minumum and maximum version values the version numbers with the dots removed and right padded with 0 up to a 3 digit long value.
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          List of categories to apply
        • SirqulKeys.scoringType
          The type of scoring this application will use {GAME_LEVEL, GAME_OBJECT}
        • SirqulKeys.hintCost
          The cost of hints
        • SirqulKeys.maxScore
          The maximum score that will be possible
        • SirqulKeys.ticketsPerPoint
          The point-to-ticket conversion ratio
        • SirqulKeys.hasGameData
          Determines whether the application uses services to save custom game objects
        • SirqulKeys.publicNotifications
          the public notifications
        • SirqulKeys.useMatchingAlgorithm
          the use matching algorithm
        • SirqulKeys.globalTickets
          Determines whether earned tickets are applied across all applications
        • SirqulKeys.buildVersion
          The current build version of the application
        • SirqulKeys.apiVersion
          The current API version the application uses
        • SirqulKeys.placementName
          The name of the placement
        • SirqulKeys.placementDescription
          The description of the placement
        • SirqulKeys.placementSize
          The ad placement size {BANNER, LEADERBOARD, SKYSCRAPER, INTERSTITIAL, CUSTOM} (this is required if a placements is to be created)
        • SirqulKeys.placementHeight
          The height of a custom ad size
        • SirqulKeys.placementWidth
          The width of a custom ad size
        • SirqulKeys.placementRefreshInterval
          The refresh interval in seconds

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse if failed, otherwise a ApplicationResponse with the generated information
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.createApplication

      • createApplicationPlacement

        public void createApplicationPlacement(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PlacementResponse>> callback)
        Creates a new ad placement for an application.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/placement/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key the ad placement is for.
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the placement
        • SirqulKeys.description
          The description of the placement
        • SirqulKeys.size
          The ad placement size {BANNER, LEADERBOARD, SKYSCRAPER, INTERSTITIAL, CUSTOM}
        • SirqulKeys.height
          The height of a custom ad size
        • SirqulKeys.width
          The width of a custom ad size
        • SirqulKeys.refreshInterval
          The refresh interval in seconds

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<PlacementResponse> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.createApplicationPlacement

Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods.       • getApplicationList

        public void getApplicationList(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<ListResponse<ApplicationShortResponse>> callback)
        Gets the application list.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/list

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the application owner/manager
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search for title, about, and description fields
        • SirqulKeys.platforms
          Deprecated, use deviceIds and deviceVersions
        • SirqulKeys.deviceIds
          The list of targeted device ids, comma separated; possible values are retreived via /audience/devices (pass in deviceId values)
        • SirqulKeys.deviceVersions
          The list of targeted device version ranges that are aligned with the provided devices list (see devices param for possible values), comma separated; examples are:
          2.3-X, 0-5.1.4, 4.3.1-6.1.4 where X is no maximum and 0 is no minimum.
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          The list of category ids to filter the list by
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on, possible values include: UPDATED (default), CREATED, TITLE
        • SirqulKeys.hasAds
          Filter results on whether the application supports ads or not. Ignore this parameter to return all results.
        • SirqulKeys.publicNotifications
          Filter results on whether the application is available for public trigger notifications
        • SirqulKeys.filterBillable
          Determines whether to only return applications that the user has access to
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The start of the pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The limit of the pagination
        • SirqulKeys.applicationIds
          The list of application ids. If provided will ignore all other params.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ListResponse<ApplicationShortResponse> that contains the results
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.getApplicationList

      • getApplicationVersions

        public void getApplicationVersions(ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Get the supported Api versions. Will return a comma separated list of numbers, newest first. For example: 3.0, 2.2, 2.1, 1.8

        Target API Endpoint: /application/versions

        Available parameters for this api

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.getApplicationVersions

      • removeApplication

        public void removeApplication(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Set the deleted timestamp to current time. This effectively deletes the application since all queries should ignore any records with a deleted time stamp.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the delete, must have rights to edit the application.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The key of the application to be deleted

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.removeApplication

      • removeApplicationPlacement

        public void removeApplicationPlacement(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Sets the ad placement to be removed from the application and effectively deleted by the user.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/placement/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.placementId
          The id of the placement to delete, the user must have rights to the application the ad placement is for

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SirqulResponse with success or fail message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

          The limit of the pagination

        the SearchResponse<PlacementResponse> on success. SirqulResponse on fail with message.
        Parameters:

        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred.       • searchApplications

        public void searchApplications(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<ApplicationResponse>> callback)
        Search for applications matching the criteria that the logged in user has access to.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account ID of the logged in user making the request
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The location of the device
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.keywordSearchFields
          The columns to applied the keyword search to
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          determines whether the sorted list is in descending or ascending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return
        • SirqulKeys.hasAds
          Filter results on whether the application supports ads or not. Ignore this parameter to return all results.
        • SirqulKeys.publicNotifications
          Filter results on whether the application is available for public trigger notifications
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Return only active results

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SearchResponse<ApplicationResponse> that contains the results, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.searchApplications

      • updateApplication

        public void updateApplication(Map<String,Object> params,
                     ISirqulCallback<ApplicationResponse> callback)
        Update an application record.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key for updating an existing application
        • SirqulKeys.appName
          The name of the application
        • SirqulKeys.about
          The description of the application
        • SirqulKeys.bundleId
          The application bundle identifier (format - com.company.appName)
        • SirqulKeys.appIconAssetId
          The application icon asset id
        • SirqulKeys.appLogoAssetId
          The application logo asset id
        • SirqulKeys.facebookAppId
          The Facebook application id
        • SirqulKeys.facebookAppSecret
          The Facebook application secret
        • SirqulKeys.googleApiKey
          This is the either the "server key" or "browser key" generated from google to enable Google Cloud Messaging
        • SirqulKeys.updateEULADate
          Determines whether to update the EULA date
        • SirqulKeys.eulaVersion
          The EULA version
        • SirqulKeys.landingPageUrl
          The landing page URL
        • SirqulKeys.showInActivities
          Determines whether to show the application in the activity feed
        • SirqulKeys.activityDescription
          The description of the application in the activity feed
        • SirqulKeys.inviteWelcomeText
          The text to display on the invite page
        • SirqulKeys.invitePageUrl
          The url to the application invite page
        • SirqulKeys.platforms
          A json object with a list of platforms supported.
          {platforms:[{ 'deviceId':1, 'minimum':230, 'maximum':421, 'downloadUrl':'http://app.store.com/download', 'description':'description and version info' }]}
          the minumum and maximum version values the version numbers with the dots removed and right padded with 0 up to a 3 digit long value.
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          List of categories to apply
        • SirqulKeys.scoringType
          The type of scoring this application will use {GAME_LEVEL, GAME_OBJECT}
        • SirqulKeys.hintCost
          The cost of hints
        • SirqulKeys.maxScore
          The maximum score that will be possible
        • SirqulKeys.ticketsPerPoint
          The point-to-ticket conversion ratio
        • SirqulKeys.hasGameData
          Determines whether the application uses services to save custom game objects
        • SirqulKeys.publicNotifications
          the public notifications
        • SirqulKeys.useMatchingAlgorithm
          the use matching algorithm
        • SirqulKeys.globalTickets
          Determines whether earned tickets are applied across all applications
        • SirqulKeys.buildVersion
          The current build version of the application
        • SirqulKeys.apiVersion
          The current API version the application uses

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse if failed, otherwise a ApplicationResponse with the generated information
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.updateApplication

      • updateApplicationActive

        public void updateApplicationActive(Map<String,Object> params,
                           ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Set the application's active flag to true/false. This effectively activates or deactivates the application.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/active

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the edit, must have rights to edit the application.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key
        • SirqulKeys.active
          If true then set to active, false otherwise

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.updateApplicationActive

      • updateApplicationPlacement

        public void updateApplicationPlacement(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PlacementResponse>> callback)
        Updates an ad placement.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/placement/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • The id of the placement to update, the user must have rights to
          the application the ad placement is for.
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the placement
        • SirqulKeys.description
          The description of the placement
        • SirqulKeys.size
          The ad placement size {BANNER, LEADERBOARD, SKYSCRAPER, INTERSTITIAL, CUSTOM}
        • SirqulKeys.height
          The height of a custom ad size
        • SirqulKeys.width
          The width of a custom ad size
        • SirqulKeys.refreshInterval
          The refresh interval in seconds

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<PlacementResponse> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        ApplicationObject.updateApplicationPlacement

      • uploadApplicationCertificate

        public void uploadApplicationCertificate(Map<String,Object> params,
                                ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Update application certificate.

        Target API Endpoint: /application/certificate/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the delete, must have rights to edit the application.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the key of the application
        • SirqulKeys.certificateFilePath
          The Apple Push Notification certificate file path

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred.
